name: reportWebinarDetails
description:
Retrieve a [report](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201393719-Webinar-Reporting) containing past webinar details.

**Scopes:** `report:read:admin`
**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`
**Prerequisites:**
* Pro or higher plan with Webinar add-on.

webinarId.description:
The webinar ID or the webinar UUID.  If a webinar ID is provided in the request instead of a UUID, the response will be for the latest webinar instance.

If a UUID starts with "/" or contains "//" (example: "/ajXp112QmuoKj4854875==\"), you must **double encode** the UUID before making an API request.

$ul: **custom_keys**: Custom keys and values assigned to the meeting.

**id**: [Meeting ID](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362373-What-is-a-Meeting-ID-): Unique identifier of the meeting in "**long**" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON), also known as the meeting number.

**total_minutes**: Number of Webinar minutes. This represents the total amount of Webinar minutes attended by each participant including the host, for a Webinar hosted by the user. For instance if there were one host(named A) and one participant(named B) in a Webinar, the value of total_minutes would be calculated as below:

**uuid**: Webinar UUID. Each webinar instance will generate its own UUID(i.e., after a meeting ends, a new UUID will be generated when the next instance of the webinar starts). Double encode the UUID when using it for API calls if the UUID begins with a '/' or contains '//' in it.
